intro: Coccoloba alnifolia, commonly known as the silky lacrosie, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America, where it typically grows in coastal areas and wetlands. The plant features palmate leaves with a soft, silvery underside that gives it its common name. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by oval, woody fruits. Coccoloba alnifolia is often used in ornamental horticulture due to its attractive foliage and adaptability to various soil conditions.
